Headline: #20 Madison Temporary Eastbound Reroute near Madison/Laramie
ShortDescription: EB 20 Madison buses are temporarily rerouted via Madison, Laramie, Washington, Cicero, and Madison due to, police activity near Madison/Laramie.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
Eastbound #20 Madison buses are temporarily rerouted via Madison, Laramie, Washington, Cicero, and Madison due to, police activity near Madison/Laramie.

Westbound buses are not affected.

Allow extra travel time.

Headline: Howard-bound Subway Trains Rerouted to Elevated Tracks
ShortDescription: Howard-bound Red Line subway trains are temporarily rerouted to the elevated tracks between Cermak and Fullerton due to a sick customer.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
Howard-bound Red Line subway trains are temporarily rerouted to the elevated tracks between Cermak and Fullerton due to a sick customer.

Train service to Howard

After stopping at Cermak-Chinatown, Howard-bound trains will be diverted and will make the following elevated station stops:

  • Roosevelt (elevated station west of Wabash; accessible)
  • Adams/Wabash
  • Washington/Wabash (accessible)
  • State/Lake
  • Clark/lake (accessible)
  • Merchandise Mart (accessible)
  • Chicago (at Franklin; accessible)
  • Sedgwick (accessible)
  • Armitage (accessible)

Then, trains will stop at Fullerton and make all normal stops to Howard.

Connections can be made between 95th/Dan Ryan-bound subway service and Howard-bound rerouted service via elevated lines at State/Lake (transfer to nearby elevated station, board on Brown Line side) and at Roosevelt (accessible).

Shuttle buses are available through the affected area.

We apologize for the inconvenience and are working to restore service as quickly as possible. Allow extra travel time.

Headline: 95th-bound Red Line trains bypassing Monroe
ShortDescription: 95th-bound Red Line trains are running, but not stopping at Monroe due to a sick customer.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
95th-bound Red Line trains are running, but not stopping at Monroe due to a sick customer.

We apologize for this inconvenience and appreciate your understanding.
